Mini 1585: Muskoka Murder Mystery

Moderated and Designed by BipolarChemist
Reviewed by AngryPidgeon, Regfan, and Mykonian



It was a dark and kind of overcast day, when they arrived at the cabin in the woods. The group of friends had known each other since preschool, inseparable they were. Of course they had their little squabbles here and there but in the end they were all the thickest of thieves! The trip was meant to end out their last summer before they all went to college, breaking them apart for the first time ever.

Spirits were high as the 14 teens dragged their half asleep asses out of the cars, a couple of them darting straight for the front door to the cabin. A few staying back at the cars unpacking their belongings, and the rest slowly making their way to two-story log cabin they had all rented together. This weekend was looking to be crazy, a truly epic way to end the summer, but little did they know this wasn’t just the end of summer for some of them…

As the night went on, the teens partied and drank and had the greatest times of their lives, one by one they wandered off to bed, sometimes in pairs, sometimes more than pairs. Eventually the party died out and the cabin returned to the quiet little house in the middle of the woods.

As the teens awoke, they stumbled around trying to overcome the horrible hangover that cursed each and every one of them. Once they all got their minds in the right place, so began the amazing breakfast feast! The smell of bacon, eggs and maple syrup filled the air, drawing everyone to the living area of the cabin. Only after they all began to chow down did they realize they were one member short. Quickly tidying up, the group split into sections to look for their missing friend, but none had to go very far, for they found their poor friend in the outhouse. Bloodied and pale, he had been gruesomely killed sometime in the night. No one had any idea who could have done it, but they did know one thing, it was at least one of them!

Day Start/End Links, Replacement Links, Etc.

Rules

(stole from pieguyn who adapted them from borkjerfkin)

General
Spoiler:
  1. Site-wide rules, as always, apply here.
  2. I reserve the right to change any of the following rules at any time. I will also inform the players in thread and via PM in the unlikely scenario in which this is required.
  3. This list is not necessarily all-inclusive. If you're unsure whether or not something is allowed, please PM me about it.
  4. Disregarding the rules may result in consequences up to and including modkill and/or force-replacement.
  5. If you need to talk to me in thread, please use bold. Additionally, feel free to PM me with any questions you might have.
  6. DO NOT TALK ABOUT OTHER ONGOING GAMES IN THIS GAME. I won't be lenient about this rule in particular.
  7. Please do not use hidden or encrypted text.
  8. Play to win.
  9. Please treat your fellow players with respect. At the same time, please try not to take comments personally whenever possible.
  10. Please allow for your fellow players to go V/LA.
  11. Please keep me in the loop about your own V/LA status.
  12. My colour is magenta. Please don’t use this colour.
  13. Have Fun!

Gameplay
Spoiler:
  1. The following vote formats are the de-facto standard on the site (aka votes should be enclosed with vote tags or bold tags. I don't care about caps/spelling/etc.)
    • VOTE: BipolarChemist
    • Vote: BipolarChemist
  2. Unvotes are not required.
  3. If it appears to be a vote for a player, I will treat it as a vote for a player. Please don't attempt to fool me or other players with regard to fake votes. Do not put votes in spoiler tags.
  4. A lynch is achieved when half plus one of the current number of living players are voting for the same player. If this does not occur by deadline, a No Lynch will occur -- there is no plurality lynch in this game.
  5. Twilight is the time between the 'hammer' vote being cast and the beginning of the night phase. All living players, including the most recent lynchee, may talk during this time.
  6. Please submit all night actions either via [ b ] tags in the designated Private Topic if you have one, or by PM if you do not.
  7. If you have a night action and do not submit one, you will not take an action. I will not resolve your action on a random person. There are no compulsive actions in this game.
  8. Role distribution is guaranteed to be random, determined with the aid of random.org

Deadlines
Spoiler:
  1. Days will be exactly 2 Weeks long.
  2. Nights will be exactly two days long.
  3. Players will be prodded after 48 hours of inactivity during the day, excepting V/LA circumstances.
  4. Failure to pick up a prod in 24 hours, or receiving 3 prods over the course of the game, will result in replacement. Asking for replacement will result in replacement.

Sample Role PM
Spoiler:
Vanilla TownWelcome to Normal 1234!

You are a Vanilla Town.

You have nothing special about you!

You win when all threats to the Town have been eliminated and have at least one Town player is alive.

The game thread is here.

Please confirm that you have received this Role PM in the thread.

Roles PMs have been sent out! Please check your inboxes and confirm in the thread!

When 11/13 have confirmed, the game will being!
/confirm
/confirm

/confirm

~F

/confirm

I'm Bert's public alt. Bert does not wish to be here at this time.

Call me Bert.

Bye.

I know I'm not a particularly experienced player but I don't think an early massclaim would be a good idea, regardless of having a Miller or not.

A townie should not lie about his role, I suppose. So, every townie claims their real role. Therefore the scums may have every data they need about the setup and the identities of the townies' roles while the townies can only have a rough estimation about the setup. Even worse, the scums can falseclaim many kind of roles that are hard to be confirmed (eg. Backup-X, Even-Night Jailkeeper) so as to confuse our setup reads. We may end up lynching our own power roles due to mistrust or serve them on a silver tray to get them nightkilled. In addition, a real turmoil would occour if we have eg. a Serial Killer out there as well...

Also, I don't see why we should test that Miller claim. As someone has already said, if that claim is true Konowa will be Nightkilled early. If not, he is going to get lynched after a couple of days because of the lack of a Nightkill. Fake-claiming a Miller has much more disadvantages than advantages.

OK, I am a vanilla town, but if this is my last post I need to make it count for town's sake, so I'm going to comb through the game once more and see what I root up, with a summary of everyone at the end. It's going to be a wall I think, and you can call it parroting, rehashing, whatever, but these are my thoughts of the game so far.

6: Given startfromtheheart's play throughout the game, I'm now extra wary of this random.org "read list". Given his playstyle it seems like an excellent way to stir up drama which he would be able to steer relatively clear of.

24: Misaka Network's reaction to the miller claim feels right to me.

64: I didn't notice this before because I merely ISO'd Boonskiies but this post follows right after the third vote on his "wagon" from Misaka. I also noticed that once I turned my attention to him he turned up immediately to defend himself but post none of the promised content.

74: This strikes me really weird. I was going to note it because we have now seen BroodKing himself require prodding, but then I reread this and realized that he already says "if your active lurking, I won't hesitate to try and lynch you...but I lurk sometimes too."

79: I still don't like BroodKing here. Like 74, it's contradictory; he accuses Boon's asking for reads of being suspicious yet does the same without providing any of his own reads.

87: Has anyone acknowledged how fudged Boon's reasoning for suspecting Konowa's vote on him while disregarding Misaka's? The two votes are identical in that they don't provide any reasoning, but Boon treats them entirely differently. He asks Konowa to explain, but essentially provides reasons as to why Misaka may have voted him. I think it's a bit suspicious but also a definite link should one of them turn up scum, considering Boonskiie's newbieness.
88: I know this post is mentioned later as evidence to show why Boon is newb town rather than newb scum but it doesn't really do anything for me. I think newb scum is just as capable of that confusion.

126 and 130: I still think these are super fishy. The first is screaming, "look at me! I'm doing something " and the second, as Guyett notes, is just a strange treatment of an RVS vote for so far in the game.

150: Guyett's response to Antihero is suspicious, instead of denying Antihero's blatant claim that he is scum, he just sort of asks to explain it, as though he's scum who is disappointed and a bit amazed by Antihero's investigative powers.

188: don_johnson's reasons for suspecting Konowa's miller claim seem farfetched to me. The first is one is circumstantial, and I'm not sure what the second even means. What exactly is proper "follow-up" to a miller claim?

The "suspicion" that formed on me on Page 8 is really strange and out of place. I'm not even remotely sure where any of the suspicion came from, given I hadn't really delved into the game at all at that point, in my opinion.

Boonskiies: I'm still really sold on this; a readthrough of the thread didn't really produce anything standing in the wayside of his scumminess. Aneninen: I don't really feel like Aneninen has been an influential entity in this game. He's really emotionally charged though, and I've questioned if that is sincere or a sort of confident-scum. Misaka Network: I actually think I align with a lot of Misaka's reads (except that which is on me obviously). His analysis and stance on the apathy of this game feel very town. While his votes are never explained within the same post, they do not feel opportunistic.

reinoe: He was certainly flailing today, and I don't think I can forgive that 180 flip on his stance on millers regardless of the context that influenced it. The group gathered in the living area of the cabin, many still in shock from what they had found. They soon found there to be no cell phone signal anywhere around, calling for help seemed futile. A few noticed pretty quickly that the tires on all the vehicles had been slashes, and the fuel drained out. Being miles from the nearest cabin, they found themselves stuck with at least one murderer and the dead body of their friend.

A couple from the group began to take charge, almost furiously accusing their fellow friends of killing another. This only sparked anger and confusion in the crowd, many erupting into tears, stomping off or even hitting others.

A loud whistle came from the middle of the crowd, the tall, fairly quiet girl stepping forward, attempting to calm everyone down. She was able to get everyone to listen for once that day, most backing down simply because they knew where these fights would lead.

Once organized they started doing their own detective work, working themselves into a bit of a frenzy trying to find the killer before they killed again. Slowly, but surely, they began to piece together what had happened here. When it was first suggested that it was the one sitting quietly in the corner, they all passed it off as “Nah, he’s harmless” or “Him? Ha, he couldn’t hurt a fly”. It slowly dawned on each and every one of them that this quiet kid could have something sinister going on within him.

The quiet kid stood up when the others began to squabble about him, attempting to sneak out of the cabin, only to be caught fairly quickly. The others began to get furious again, some even calling for his death! Those some took ahold of the situation, dragging him out to the front of the cabin. Many couldn’t watch what was happening in front of them, but stayed anyways, their eyes glued to this quiet, seemingly harmless kid. They group began yelling at him, berating him. He didn’t break, only keeping an oddly sinister smile on his face as they locked him in a small shed out back.


Chevre, Mafia Goon, was lynched Day 1.

It is now Night 1. All actions are due in: (expired on 2014-07-11 21:00:00)

Day 2 Start


As the drama died down, the teens gathered in the cabin, leaving behind a couple to watch the shed. Most had cooled off at this point, some trying to figure out what the hell to do now, others trying to comfort the ones taking the situation hard.

The day was starting to get late, and the group knew it was going to have to stay at least the night before they could set out to find help. It was very quiet that evening. No one really wanted to discuss the events of the night.

Slowly they all began falling asleep, but still on their guards. A few barely staying awake attempting to protect those asleep. All was for not, as when the group arose in the morning, they were met with another gruesome surprise. One of the shed guards sat slumped against the shed, throat slit, lifeless and pale. The other knocked out cold beside him.

In the shed they found the body of the quiet kid, a knife sticking out of his chest, with a note attached. It read: “One by one, who will survive?”


reinoe, Vanilla Town, was killed Night 1!

End of Day 2

The group immediately became enraged and confused, a horrible combo, upon the discovery of the piling up body count. Right away, a couple began to pack for the trek to find help, but soon the thunderclouds rolled in. Rain began to slowly drizzle and then shower and finally it began pouring. You could barely see 5 feet in front of you. There was no way anyone could go out in this.

The teens brought all the bodies to the shed for the time being, all while trying to work out what the hell was going on. Once they were all huddled inside, the fireplace lit, they were at each other’s throats. Soon the group turned on one, advancing towards her with sinister looks in their faces. They were blaming her, yelling at her. “You killed them” and “you murderer”.

She soon joined the bodies in the shed.


Misaka Network, Vanilla Town, has been lynched on Day 2.

It is now Night 2. All actions are due in: (expired on 2014-07-21 02:00:00)
Day will begin a bit late, apologies for the inconvenience!

Start of Day 3


The group was horrified at what they had done. They all sat in silence in the cabin; no one would say a word. Many tried to chalk it up to them just being scared, there’s a killer about. Maybe it was that girl? They had no idea, but this frightened group of teens was dwindling with no way to find help.

The storm raged on outside, the thunder intensifying, shaking the house with every boom, and sending a shock up each and every one’s back. No one could sleep that night; everyone was on edge, afraid for their lives. This did not stop another from being picked off.

One of the guys that took the lead in killing that poor girl seemingly passed out early in the morning in a corner of the cabin, a couple friends around him making sure nothing happened. As the day approached noon, he was still passed out in the corner. The group began to worry and attempted to wake him up. He was cold. He must have gone sometime in the night. This killer was still at it and getting more and more clever. Who will be next?


don_johnson, Town Jailkeeper, was killed Night 2!

I was thinking.
Since we have no better option, I'm going to take the lead of the town.
I know that you can't be sure about my alignment but at least, due to the tracking you can consider me almost 100% town (regardless of Chaos's alignment). In addition: it's clear that I can't have any night-action PR (by the way, other kinds of PRs would be highly unlikely too, see later) which means I'm expendable as well.

The logic about why my VT claim was true:

Spoiler:
There are the following possibilities:

(1) Chaos is Town Tracker and I'm VT. Nothing extra-ordinary in this case. I still might have a PR with no night target ability or it might be possible that I didn't use my ability at Night2. In both cases I would stfu and wouldn't tell you that I'm expendable. (Unless I'd be an X-shot Bulletproof but we all wish I were one.)

(2) Chaos is Town Tracker and I'm scum. The original setup is most probably 10:3. (There were no multiple Nightkills and 9:4 would be absurd.) One Mafia Goon is down. Amongst the other two there must be a Rolecop: Don't Nightkill is only logical if they knew who he was or at least they knew that he was targetting someone before. As Bert wrote it in 1016, the standard procedure is that one of the scums performs the Kill while the other one performs the Night Action. In both cases if I were scum, I would have done something and Chaos would have known about it. His "no action" read would have been possible only if my scum partner had performed both the Kill and the Targetting. This could be possible if my partner were the Rolecop, but in this case I'd stfu instead of trying rolefishing the scum group. In short, (2) is not entirely impossible but very unlikely.

(3) Chaos is Scum and I'm VT. That's an interesting version. In this case he may be either the Mafia Tracker or the Mafia Rolecop. The sequence of the events could have been the following. Night 1: Chaos tracks Don. Day 2: he claims Tracker and says he tracked Reinoe (there's no way to confirm or contradict this). Night 2: Mafia kills Don (either they knew he was a Jailkeeper or they only knew that he had a PR). Day 3: he makes up his tracking about me. That may be risky but, telling that he tracked Don would have been way too suspicious. So, he takes the risk and makes up a name. He's lucky because without having a PR with Night-targetting I can't counterclaim him. I think (1) is more likely than (3) but, the fact that he haven't tracked Konowa yet makes (3) more probable. (If I were a Tracker I'd have been tracked Konowa during Night1. It's still possible that Knowa doesn't perform an action – though, if the scums indeed have a Rolecop, that's not too likely, see (2)! – but, as for Millers, a Tracker can get more info about them than a Cop, since the Copread is useless.)

(3/2) Both Konowa and Chaos are scum. A weird idea but it's not impossible. That would explain why didn't he track Konowa and if they bus each other effectively, none of us will consider the un-lynched one out of them after the other one will have flipped scum... or would we? ^_^ By the way, if (3/2) is true my alignment is town, yet again. (There can't be three living scums.)

(4) Both Chaos and I are scum. In this case faking tracking me would be nonsense. We'd know that Konowa's claim was real and he could have lied that he checked Konowa's claim with the tracking (regardless of his real target, Chaos' possible roles if he's scum are detailed under (3)). This version is impossible in practitce, I think, and not only because I would have advised Chaos to track Konowa (or f-ck, anyone else but me). If we were both scum, there could be an investigate role on the town side as well. If a "real" town Tracker targetted me later and got a positive result, it would be pretty much game over for us. (See (2) for details, especially the "one scum Kills, the other one performs the action part. If a Cop gets a "scum" read on me after targetting, the situation is rougly the same, though there would be a slim chance that Chaos got away with the story.)


Conclusion: I'll examine everything thorougly as soon as I can. Feel free to point out if my logic in the forthcoming posts are wrong but, until we have a 100,00% confirmed town player, you should trust me. Even if I'm not the smartest player on the forum, I'll try to do my best.

End of Day 3


As the days long storm raged outside, the group began to make preparations to make the trek outside together in the storm. They had decided it would be best for them to all go as one large group, instead of splitting up and causing excess risk with this killer out there. There were a couple opposed to this trek outside, they figured with all this talk of risk, why are they risking their lives against the elements AND a killer now? Most of these complaints were just grumbles, nothing really of note, until one stood up and explained how bad of an idea this was. No one listened to him, he was ignored and the group continued with the preparations.

This one rebel got more and more frustrated with these people he once considered friends and decided to take matters into his own hands. He wanted to prove to them how dangerous it was outside. He grabbed his jacket and some thicker boots and stomped outside, making sure everyone heard his rage. The ground was slick, mud had formed everywhere. He nearly slipped and fell multiple times as he head out towards the trail that lead the teens to the cabin. He stopped near the broken down cars, and raised his arms in the air.

"See how stupid this is? You people won't make it a mile before one of you breaks something!" He yelled, his voice barely audible over the clattering of the rain.

One of the vehicles began to noticeably shift in the mud. The ground had softened and moved enough that heavier objects were slipping quickly. As the man yelled, the teens motioned for him to get out of the way, yelling and screaming for him to move. A couple ran to get him before the car struck the teen down. The car had picked up speed now, the rear coming towards him, possibly enough to run him down. Before the others could save him, the teen finally noticed the vehicle barrelling towards him and jumped out of the way, being clipped by the corner of the car and falling to the ground. The front tire of the car pinned his legs, his face towards the ground. He tried to yell, but the muddy water had risen and filled his mouth. The ones that tried to save him stood staring momentarily, before rushing to help him. Moving the car would only mangle this kids leg more, but he was drowning. The teens all pushed the car as hard as they could, finally getting it off his leg. They carried him inside and set him in the middle of the living area. They had been too late.

Riddleton, Vanilla Town, was lynched Day 3.

It is now Night 3. Please have any actions submitted before the deadline of: (expired on 2014-08-08 13:00:00)
The game will be updated tomorrow evening. Apologies for the lag, everything will return to normal shortly

Start of Day 4


The teens quickly realized that going out in the storm was not going to work. It had taken one of their friends in no time.

While all that commotion had gone on, a killer had done some dirty work. It was an amazing distraction. After the teens calmed down from yet another loss, they soon realized something was off. They were one member short that they should have been. They feared the worst immediately, scrambling to find the lost member.

After an hour of searching, they came up with nothing. She was gone. Had she gone out in the storm? Did the killer get her? The group was on edge more than ever before. It wasn't long before they were at each other's throats...


chaoslord54, Town Tracker, has died Night 3!

End of the Game


The group was dwindling, teen by teen. Each being taken out in a new, inventive way, and totally not a rip off of other people's ideas. 7 teens dropped to 6 when the group got nervous about the food being served, paranoid the one who cooked spiked the eggs. They turned savage on him feeding him every last egg they had. As it turned out, someone got to the eggs before they were even cooked. Now at 6 teens, the group sat awake at night, no one sleeping. This went on for 2 nights, no sleep, everyone too afraid to leave the cabin in fear of the storm picking up again. It had turned to only a light drizzle now. One teen got fed up with the no sleep and grabbed the bottle of sleeping pills one of the dead members had in their pack, crushing them up and spiking the drinking water. He waited until everyone had a drink of it before finally he had some himself, sure that everyone would be asleep and they would be safe. He was dead wrong (he was stabbed in the face that night).

Now down to 5 left, the remaining members decided it was time to brave the outside world. Exiting the cabin, they noticed the rain picking up slightly as they trekked up the road. They all kept their distance from one another, constantly checking around, making sure no one was going to stab them or kill them in some other super creative way. The storm picked up even more half way to the neighbour's cabin. The road became slick yet again, a stream running beside the road picked up in speed, the volume of water rose, encroaching on the road. One girl stumbled on a loose rock, falling into the guy in front of her. He immediately turned around, forcefully shoving her away. She stumbled backwards now, falling into the stream, hitting her head off of a rock on the bottom. She began to float in the stream, while the one who pushed her began yelling about how she tried to push him in, how she was going to kill him. The teens did nothing to save this girl.

Finally after the long trek in the storm, they reached the neighbours cabin only to find it empty. They all began to search the place, looking for a landline, or any form of communication with the outside world. Once the reconvened in the common space, they realized the place had nothing. It had been a loss. They decided to stay here for the night, hoping the storm would lighten up by morning so they could head to the next place. Of course, someone didn't make it through the night. They all had the 'bright' idea of splitting up and staying in different rooms. Well in the morning, they found one cabinmate chopped up and a piece in each of their rooms.

Now only 3 left. The yelling began. They all screamed and went at each other for hours, the fighting went into the night and back into the day again. Shoving and pushing each other around until finally someone snapped. He shoved the last girl left and she stumbled backwards, falling onto the hardwood floor. He stood over her and with a disgusted look on his face he took out the last of his rage, thinking she had to be the killer, he killed her first.

Standing above him after he finished killing the poor girl was the only other teen left.

"Good Choice" the other teen said...
